intro: Cyrtandra rarotongensis, commonly known as the Cook Islands bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Cook Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. It has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
